subject: Re: [junit] Runnable JAR, creating separate main()
msgSnippet: You need a main class and point to the main class in the manifest. If your class has dependencies those need to be listed in the manifests classpath. The first
messageBody:
You need a main class and point to the main class in the manifest.
If your class has dependencies those need to be listed in the manifests
classpath.

The first hit on google when you search for runnable jar gives the details
in a no nonsense form

This is not really a JUnit question but more general java.

HTH
-----------------------------------------------------
Blog: johlrogge.wordpress.com
Twitter: @johlrogge
E-mail: joakim.ohlrogge@...


On Tue, Oct 18, 2011 at 12:19 AM, JohnS <keltix@...> wrote:

> **
>
>
> I'm trying to create a runnable JAR in eclipse using Junit 4.9 but I
> can't get it right.
>
> This website says it is necessary to create a separate class 'main'
> http://www.javahotchocolate.com/tutorials/jars-and-wars.html#junit
>
> I contacted him and he says to try something like this:
>
> package packege_name;
>
> import junit.textui.TestRunner;
>
> public class RunnableTest {
> public static void main(String[] args) {
>
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestCase.class); // separate
>
> }
> }
>
> But I get an error for 'run'.
> Am I forgetting to import something?
> Exporting the above code creates a 3MB JAR but it does nothing when I
> click it.
>
> any ideas?
>
>
>
